name: Trisquel
description: Trisquel is a fully free GNU/Linux distribution based on Ubuntu, endorsed by the Free Software Foundation. It removes all non-free software, firmware, and drivers.

sections.title: Early Years
sections.text: Trisquel was launched in 2007 with support from the University of Vigo, aiming to provide a fully free alternative to Ubuntu.

sections.title: Growth and Development
sections.text: Trisquel built a niche user base focused on software freedom. It includes only free software components and uses Abrowser, a de-branded version of Firefox, as its web browser.

sections.title: Current Status
sections.text: Trisquel is maintained by a small team and endorsed by the Free Software Foundation. It is used in environments that require strict adherence to software freedom principles.

sections.title: 100% Free Software Mission
sections.text: Trisquel removes proprietary drivers, blobs, and software, focusing on ethical computing and supporting users who value digital freedom above all else.
